alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 2:47AM CDT until August 07 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Marshall, McLean, Peoria, Stark, Tazewell and Woodford. In west central Illinois, Fulton and Knox. * WHEN...From this afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of scattered thunderstorms are expected this afternoon into the overnight hours across areas that recently received heavy rainfall. Peak rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible. New rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Fulton; Knox; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford
